p: PCR is a highly versatile technique. A number of variants of the conventional PCR have been developed, but the most important variants are reverse transcription-PCR and real-time PCR [ 1, 10]. The first method was devised to amplify ribonucleic acid (RNA) targets [ 1]; the second technique was introduced to quantify deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) in real time throughout the PCR reactions [ 56].
